define.name: PORT_NUMBER
define.description: Port number server is listening on for normal connections.

define.name: PORT_NUMBER_SSL
define.description: Port number server is listening on for secured connections.

define.name: ENABLE_SSL
define.description: Enable or disable secured communication to this server. It is suggested to enable this if possible.

_define.name: ENABLE_LOGGING
_define.description: Enable the ability for the system to log to the filesystem.

_define.name: LOGDIR
_define.description:
Directory log files are written to. MUST end in the directory separator for the OS, ie: / or \ for win32. If this begins with a / or [drive]:/ absolute files are used, else relative to the root directory is used.
**NOTICE** This directory MUST be writable by the user who executes PHP, usually apache or www-data.

_define.name: LOG_FILEFORMAT
_define.description: Format of log files. This can contain several variables, such as... * {date???} - replace ??? with the date format you want as per php's Date() function * @see http://www.php.net/date * {filename} - Filename requested to be saved from the application, such as user, email, access, etc... * {remoteIP} - Remote IP of the connecting machine. * {type} - Type of error, such as notice, warning, error, etc...

_define.name: LOG_LINEFORMAT
_define.description: Format inside log files. This can contain the above mentioned variables plus... * {text} - Body message of error. (really probably should have at least this...)

define.name: SITENAME
define.description: The site name that can be used for emails and page titles.

return.name: site_url
return.description: If a site url is provided and not blank, force the servername to match it. Useful for restricting access to www.domain.com. Please note, if you set this to an invalid location, you or anyone else will NOT be able to access the site.

define.name: DEVELOPMENT_MODE
define.description: If this is a production site, it is advised to disable this.

define.name: TMP_DIR
define.description: The location of the tmp directory for cache, compile, and general temporary files. Please ensure that this ends with a "/"
